instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message:
Hi,

I got this macbook with cracked LCD. I changed the LCD, no backlight and no screen, and no picture on external display.

No liquid damage for sure. I checked:

L8930
L8960
L8360
L8310
nothing on them.
GPU is ice cold.

I can't take this to Apple. PO ripped off the screw sleeves of the board.
I don't have <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>. This could be a bad GMUX?

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message:
Update:

Checked <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> GMUX.
I've <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_DPMUX_UC_R</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3_DPMUX_UC_R</SIGNAL> too.
So it has all the powers rails.

Y9100 is missing. Looks like it does not need clock signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message: Looks like you might have the bad luck of GPU being dead right as you replaced the screen. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message: The question is was this working before you did the LCD. The other question is did you remove the board before you did the LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message: The PO removed the cracked LCD, and he said it was working before. So who knows?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message: I can tell you it wasn't. Does it even chime? Does a USB mouse light up?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message:
Yes, it does. It chimes and boots into OS X. Just nothing on the screen.
I can set the volume up and down. I also can change the keyboard backlight.
Just no picture, I tried external it shows black screen and after a sec no signal, and then black screen and then no signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message:
[QUOTE="bighead, post: 2175"]The PO removed the cracked LCD, and he said it was working before. So who knows?[/QUOTE]


He's lying to try and trick you fixing the GPU issue on the board for free. Sell a GTFO.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message: remove lvds cable then connect with external screen ... and see if there any thing on screen  ....
